name: Statue of Liberty
tagline: American icon in New York Harbor
description: Iconic National Monument opened in 1886, offering guided tours, a museum & city views.

name: Central Park
tagline: Urban oasis with ballfields & a zoo
description: Sprawling park with pedestrian paths & ballfields, plus a zoo, carousel, boat rentals & a reservoir.

name: Empire State Building
description: Iconic, art deco office tower from 1931 with exhibits & observatories on the 86th & 102nd floors.

name: Times Square
description: Bustling destination in the heart of the Theater District known for bright lights, shopping & shows.

name: Metropolitan Museum of Art
description: A grand setting for one of the world's greatest collections of art, from ancient to contemporary.

name: Brooklyn Bridge
description: Beloved, circa-1883 landmark connecting Manhattan & Brooklyn via a unique stone-&-steel design.

name: High Line
tagline: Park built into old elevated rail line
description: Popular park 30 feet above street level on an old rail line, with river & city views.

name: Rockefeller Center
description: Famous complex that's home to TV studios, plus a seasonal ice rink & giant Christmas tree.

name: Museum of Modern Art
description: Works from van Gogh to Warhol & beyond plus a sculpture garden, 2 cafes & The Modern restaurant.

name: Grand Central Terminal
description: Iconic train station known for its grand facade & main concourse, also offering shops & dining.

name: The Battery
description: Historic park with Ellis Island & Statue of Liberty views & ferry service to both islands.

name: Theatre District
description: The Theater District is the teeming heart of Midtown West. In the pedestrian plazas of Times Square, costumed characters beckon to energetic crowds under the pulsing lights of towering digital

name: One World Trade Center
description: A casual cafe, a bar with small plates & American fine dining with views from the 101st floor.

name: Liberty Island
tagline: Famous place with the Statue of Liberty
description: Audio & guided tours are offered on this iconic island featuring the Statue of Liberty & a museum.

name: 9/11 Memorial
description: Plaza, pools & exhibits honoring victims of 1993 & 2001 WTC terrorist attacks. Free timed admission.

name: Chinatown
tagline: Asian dining, fish markets & Tai Chi
description: Vibrant Chinatown is a densely populated neighborhood that draws foodies and tourists to its many Chinese and Southeast Asian restaurants for dumplings, pork buns and hand-pulled noodles. The

name: SoHo, Manhattan
description: Designer boutiques, fancy chain stores and high-end art galleries make trendy SoHo a top shopping destination, especially for out-of-towners. Known for its elegant cast-iron-facades and cobblestone

name: Coney Island
description: Coney Island is a residential Brooklyn neighborhood that morphs into a relaxation and entertainment destination each summer. Locals and tourists crowd its beach, the Wonder Wheel and Luna Park

name: American Museum of Natural History
description: From dinosaurs to outer space and everything in between, this huge museum showcases natural wonders.

name: Solomon R. Guggenheim Museum
tagline: Modern art museum with a notable design
description: Frank Lloyd Wright–designed modern-art museum with an architecturally significant spiral rotunda.

name: The Plaza
tagline: Landmark luxury hotel with posh dining
description: Iconic 19th-century lodging offering fine dining & afternoon tea, plus a champagne bar & a spa.

name: Greenwich Village
tagline: Hip bars, cafes & Washington Square Park
description: The epicenter of the city's 1960s counterculture movement, the tree-lined streets of Greenwich Village are now a hub of popular cafes, bars and restaurants. Jazz clubs and Off-Broadway Theaters

name: Bryant Park
description: Green space behind the NY Public Library's main branch, with 4 acres, a cafe and other food kiosks.

name: Broadway
tagline: Musical theatre, The Lion King, and opera
description: Broadway is a road in the U.S. state of New York. Broadway runs from State Street at Bowling Green for 13 mi through the borough of Manhattan and 2 mi through the Bronx, exiting north from the

name: Flatiron Building
description: Architect Daniel Burnham's iconic 1902 triangular tower nicknamed for its clothes iron look.

name: Chrysler Building
tagline: 1930s art deco tower with a storied past
description: Shimmering art deco skyscraper from 1930 whose spire once made it the world's tallest building.

name: Staten Island Ferry
tagline: The Staten Island Ferry is a passenger ferry route operated by the New York City Department of Transportation. The ferry's single route runs 5.2 miles through New York Harbor between the New

name: DUMBO
description: Trendy Dumbo's cobblestone streets and converted Brooklyn warehouse buildings are the backdrop for independent boutiques, high-end restaurants and trendy cafes. Near the waterfront, St. Ann's

name: Little Italy
description: Little Italy welcomes a heavily tourist crowd to its high concentration of souvenir shops and traditional Italian eateries and bakeries. Tenement buildings, once home to the immigrants who settled

name: Madison Square Garden
tagline: Iconic venue for sports, concerts & more
description: Billed as the "world's most famous arena", this icon hosts pro sports, concerts & other big events.

name: Union Square, Manhattan
description: The lively Union Square neighborhood is anchored by it's namesake pedestrian plaza and bustling park, which attracts a mix of professionals, street artists, students and protesters. The surrounding

name: St. Patrick's Cathedral
description: Towering Neo-Gothic church from 1879 with twin spires & storied history opposite Rockefeller Center.

name: Bronx Zoo
description: Metropolitan zoo with 265 acres that harbors 4,000 animals in replicas of their native habitats.

name: Prospect Park
tagline: City green space with basketball courts
description: Sprawling city park featuring basketball & handball courts, a playground & a historic home.

name: Lower East Side
tagline: Hip bars & dining, plus Tenement Museum
description: The eclectic Lower East Side is where gritty alleys and tenement-style buildings mix with upscale apartments and chic boutiques. Nighttime draws hip, young crowds to the area's trendy bars, music

name: Chelsea Market
tagline: Shops, eateries & more in bustling space
description: Indoor marketplace renowned for its wide range of grocers (fish, produce, etc.), shops & eateries.

name: Roosevelt Island
description: Roosevelt Island is a narrow island in New York City's East River. It lies between Manhattan Island to its west and the borough of Queens, on Long Island, to its east. It is politically part

name: Washington Square Park
description: Historic Greenwich Village concrete-&-green park known for its stately arch & prime people-watching.

name: Financial District
description: This is the city's buzzing financial heart, home to Wall Street and glittering skyscrapers. Sidewalks bustle during the week and, after work, young professionals fill the restaurants and bars

name: Intrepid Sea, Air & Space Museum
tagline: Flight museum on an aircraft carrier
description: Flight museum on an aircraft carrier whose exhibits include a Concorde, submarine & space shuttle.

name: Meatpacking District
description: The Meatpacking District is a hip commercial area on the far west side. It's home to the Whitney Museum of American Art, high-end designer clothing stores and a stretch of the High Line, an elevated

name: Manhattan Bridge
description: Opened in 1909, this suspension bridge between Brooklyn & Manhattan is known for its ornate portal.

name: Central Park Zoo
tagline: Small zoo with penguins & sea lions
description: Set within Central Park, this small zoo features penguins, sea lions, monkeys & a petting zoo.

name: New York Harbor
description: New York Harbor, part of the Port of New York and New Jersey, is at the mouth of the Hudson River where it empties into New York Bay and into the Atlantic Ocean at the East Coast of the United

name: Columbus Circle
description: Columbus Circle is a traffic circle and heavily trafficked intersection in the New York City borough of Manhattan, located at the intersection of Eighth Avenue, Broadway, Central Park South,

name: Flatiron District
description: Named after the iconic wedge-shaped Flatiron Building, this commercial neighborhood is also home to tall apartment buildings and office high-rises. Locals and tourists frequent the hip bars,

name: East Village
description: The East Village is known for its happening nightlife. Old-school bars, music venues and performance spaces share the streets with posh cocktail lounges, hip restaurants. Daytime sees a more

name: New York Botanical Garden
description: Sprawling spot of 50 gardens, 30,000 trees & landmark glasshouse with rain forest & cactus displays.

name: Brooklyn Botanic Garden
description: A kid-friendly annual Cherry Blossom Festival, a Japanese garden & more, spread across 52 acres.

name: Radio City Music Hall
tagline: Legendary theater, home of the Rockettes
description: Circa-1932 art deco theater hosting the Christmas Spectacular with the Rockettes, concerts & more.
